doc.previous: In more formal language A von Neumann Morgenstern utility function is a function from choices to the real numbers
doc.after: which assigns a real number to every outcome in a way that captures the agent s preferences over simple lotteries Under the four assumptions mentioned above the agent will prefer a lottery to a lottery if and only if the expected utility of is greater than the expected utility of
